contextId.occurrenceNote: Since people see with the eyes, the word "eye" is used to refer to people. Alternate translation: "every person" or "everyone" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
This refers to the person speaking. Alternate translation: "who" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
Here the word "feet" represent the person before whom these people bow down. Alternate translation: "before you" or "to you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])

The voice refers to the one who was speaking. John does not say who the speaker was, but it may have been God. Alternate translation: "I heard someone speaking" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
The voice refers to the speaker. Alternate translation: "The speaker said" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
The word "voice" refers to words spoken by someone other than the angel. Alternate translation: "but I heard someone speaking from heaven" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: καὶ ... ἤκουσα φωνὴν ἐκ τοῦ οὐρανοῦ
contextId.glQuote: but I heard a voice from heaven

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "voice" refers to the speaker. Alternate translation: "The one I heard speak from heaven" or "The one who had spoken to me from heaven" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: ἡ φωνὴ ... ἤκουσα ἐκ τοῦ οὐρανοῦ
contextId.glQuote: The voice I heard from heaven

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to all the salt water lakes and oceans. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
This refers to all bodies of fresh water. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: ποταμοὺς καὶ τὰς πηγὰς τῶν ὑδάτων
contextId.glQuote: rivers and the springs of water
